item.title: Lamport Distributed Mutual Exclusion
item.description: Normally, having consistent event ordering in a distributed system is hard because we have no common clock. Since we don’t have a common clock to measure with, we rely on logical properties of time in the absence of clock.

item.title: Specifying Token Ring for Mutual Exclusion
item.description: Mutual exclusion is a common term appearing frequently in computer sciences. In essence, it’s a mechanism of concurrency control allowing exclusive access to some resource (or ‘‘critical region’').
